required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Tucidinostat, Azacitidine Combined With CHOP Versus CHOP in Patients With Untreated Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Phase III, Non-randomized Study of Tucidinostat, Azacitidine Combined With CHOP Versus CHOP in Patients With Untreated Peripheral T-cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, multicenter, phase III study of Tucidinostat, Azacitidine combined with CHOP versus CHOP in patients with untreated peripheral T-cell lymphoma

detailed_description.textblock: Tucidinostat, a novel histone deacetylase inhibitor has been approved for the treatment of relapsed or refractory peripheral T-cell lymphoma in China. Azacytidine is a hypomethylating agent. The aim of this study is to compare the efficacy and safety of azacytidine, tucidinostat combined with CHOP regimen and classical CHOP regimen in the treatment of primary PTCL

primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 course of treatment (each cycle is 21 days)
primary_outcome.description: the total proportion of patients with complete response (CR) and partial response (PR)

secondary_outcome.description: Time from treatment until disease progression or death
Time from treatment until death from any cause

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events, serious adverse events and other safety parameters
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence, nature, and severity of adverse events graded according to the NCI CTCAE v5.0

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Hematology, Peking University First Hospital
